snippet: The bipartisan group’s overhaul of an immigration law would decrease the amount of time it takes to become a naturalized citizen, but increase the wait for a green card.
abstract: Nation’s 11 million illegal immigrants would have to wait a full decade for a green card but could earn citizenship just three years after that, under provision being finalized by bipartisan group of eight senators working to devise an overhaul of immigration law

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: The bipartisan group’s overhaul of an immigration law would decrease the amount of time it takes to become a naturalized citizen, but increase the wait for a green card.

headline.seo: Senate Group’s Immigration Plan Would Alter Waiting Periods
headline.main: A Senate Plan Alters Waiting Periods for Immigration
headline.print_headline: Senators’ Plan Alters Waiting Periods for Immigration
